sen.j: 藤間 勘十郎（ふじま かんじゅうろう）は、藤間流勘十郎派の名跡。
sen.e: Kanjuro FUJIMA is the professional name used by the head of the Fujima school and the Kanjuro style of performance.
Kanjuro FUJIMA is the professional name used by the head of the Fujima school and the Kanjuro style of performance.
Kanjuro FUJIMA is the professional name used by the head of the Fujima school and the Kanjuro line of performance.

sen.j: 当代8代目宗家藤間流家元。
sen.e: The current holder of the name is the eighth-generation family head, and his family is the head family in the Fujima school.
The current holder of the name is the eighth-generation family head, and his family is the head family in the Fujima school.
The current holder of the name is the eighth-generation family head, and his family is the head family in the Fujima school.

sen.j: 本来の初代
sen.e: The original founder of the Kanjuro line
The original founder of the Kanjuro line
The original founder of the Kanjuro line

sen.j: - 後の藤間勘兵衛3代目。
sen.e: - He later became Kanbe FUJIMA III.
- He later became Kanbe FUJIMA III.
- He later became Kanbe FUJIMA III.

sen.j: 藤間勘兵衛が一時名乗った「勘十郎」の名を代数に入れずその門下で養子の藤間大助が名乗った「勘十郎」を初代としている。
sen.e: But it was not Kanbe FUJIMA who passed the name "Kanjuro," which he temporarily used as his professional name, down to later generations.
But it was not Kanbe FUJIMA who passed the name "Kanjuro," which he temporarily used as his professional name, down to later generations.

But it was not Kanbe FUJIMA who passed the name 'Kanjuro,' which he temporarily used as his professional name, down to later generations; instead, it was his pupil and adopted son Daisuke FUJIMA who founded the 'Kanjuro' line.
sen.cmt: 原文が途中で切れていたので、原文訳文ともに次の文と繋げました。" "→' '

sen.j: 藤間 勘十郎（寛政8年（1796年） - 天保11年12月24日 (旧暦)（1841年1月16日））
sen.e: Kanjuro FUJIMA (1796 - Jan. 16, 1841)
Kanjuro FUJIMA (1796 - Jan. 16, 1841)

sen.j: 3代目藤間勘兵衛の養子で門下。
sen.e: He was the adopted son and pupil of Kanbe FUJIMA III.
He was the adopted son and pupil of Kanbe FUJIMA III.
He was the adopted son and pupil of Kanbe FUJIMA III.

sen.j: 瀬山大助、藤間大助を経て36歳で勘十郎を襲名した。
sen.e: His original professional name was Daisuke SEYAMA, and he changed it to Daisuke FUJIMA before succeeding, at the age of 38, to the name Kanjuro FUJIMA.
His original professional name was Daisuke SEYAMA, and he changed it to Daisuke FUJIMA before succeeding, at the age of 38, to the name Kanjuro FUJIMA.
His original name was Daisuke SEYAMA, and he changed it to Daisuke FUJIMA before succeeding, at the age of 38, to the name Kanjuro FUJIMA.

sen.j: 中村歌右衛門 (4代目)、関三十郎 (2代目)の変化舞踊の振付けをする。
sen.e: He created the choreography for the transformation dances of Utaemon NAKAMURA IV and Sanjuro SEKI II.
He created the choreography for the transformation dances of Utaemon NAKAMURA IV and Sanjuro SEKI II.
He created the choreography for the transformation dances of Utaemon NAKAMURA IV and Sanjuro SEKI II.

sen.j: 仇名を「踊りっ子」。
sen.e: His nickname was "Odorikko" (Dancer Boy).
His nickname was "Odorikko" (Dancer Boy).
His nickname was 'Odorikko' (Dancer Boy).

sen.j: 藤間 勘十郎（文政6年（1823年） - 明治15年（1882年））藤間流3代目宗家。
sen.e: Kanjuro FUJIMA II (1823-1882) was the third-generation head of the Fujima school of performance.
Kanjuro FUJIMA II (1823-1882) was the third-generation head of the Fujima school of performance.
Kanjuro FUJIMA II (1823 - 1882) was the third-generation head of the Fujima school of performance.

sen.j: 初代勘兵衛の養女。
sen.e: She was the adopted daughter of the family founder Kanbe.

sen.j: 本名はよし。
sen.e: Her real name was Yoshi.

sen.j: 2代目から5代目までは女性で劇場振付けを行なわなかった。
sen.e: The second- thru fifth-generation holders of the name Kanjuro FUJIMA were women, and as such did not perform their choreography on stage.

sen.j: なお、別家元（慶応2年（1866年） - 明治21年（1888年） 8月19日）が3代目勘兵衛（名義上4代目）を名乗った。
sen.e: Note that a different branch family's head (who was born 1866 and died August 19, 1888) took the name Kanbe FUJIMA III (though nominally Kanbe FUJIMA IV).
Note that a different branch family's head (who was born 1866 and died August 19, 1888) took the name Kanbe FUJIMA III (though nominally Kanbe FUJIMA IV).

sen.e: Like Kanjuro FUJIMA III, the head of a different family branch (? - 1892) took the name Kanbe FUJIMA IV (though nominally Kanbe FUJIMA V).

sen.j: 尾上菊五郎 (6代目)を幼少から指導し後に 名人と称えられる。
